title: Anticrisp
content:
Headbangers Nostalgic Typophiles:   
   
-This font was designed and inspired listening with some good Heavy-Thrash Metal Old 80`s bands, i hope that this design would be usefull.   
   
-At 100% it looks with no Jagged angles(smoth angles?)   
   
-i try to make something like ligatures, "edgedures" ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415090403im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Please critique.   
   
MH   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415090403im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/8637.gif)
author: Miguel Hernandez

comments.content:
really nice. interesting, the long "i".   
   
some comments:   
-try to make the "f" ascending.   
-the tail in "j" seems too long.   
-the "r" in "Brown"/"Over" looks better than the   
"r" in your alphabet setting.   
-check the "p" in "Anticrisp Heavy Metal". it

ok.   
A, it swaps horizontals with 45', over and over again.   
B, verticals stay the same, but offset in-glyph by A.   
   
Every time I look at it my brain's type reader gets all drunk and starts playing air guitar at 45'.   
   
As others have said, it's very refined. I can't tell if the "p" is different.   
   
disclaimer: I am not impartial. and I play air guitar poorly.
